content: **CTA**: Specific next step, nie generic "learn more"
**Hook Format**: Contrarian statement w pierwszym zdaniu
Untested code → odrzucenie przez Quality Assessor
[ ] Włączyć ethics gates do editorial review
If untested code found → quality_approved = False
**Skeptical Learner Elements**: "Common pitfalls", "When not to use" sections
**Structure**: Insight → Data → Strategic Implications → Action Items
Never nest: "API URL" not "API for the URL"
**Evidence Stack**: Data + expert quotes + market analysis
"Test Everything" - każdy trend musi mieć źródła do weryfikacji
**Personal Frame**: "Here's what I learned...", "Mistake I see..."
**Humanization**: Emoji usage (max 2 per tweet), casual language
Senior Engineer (30%): Needs technical depth, architecture patterns
Brak 3 źródeł → odrzucenie przez Content Scout
❌ Too Casual: "This API is totally borked lol"
Needs: Strategic insights, technical depth, contrarian takes
Subject lines: Specific benefit, nie clickbait
No anonymous sources for positive claims
✓ Just Right: "This API breaks in fascinating ways"
**Test Everything** - Every claim, every tool, every line of code
If you can't find 3 sources, DON'T include the topic
Sensitive topics: AI ethics, deepfakes, manipulation
**Visual**: Diagram lub screenshot, nie stock photos
Comments strategy: Respond w pierwszej godzinie
Forbidden phrases → odrzucenie przez Decision Coordinator
**Visual Hierarchy**: H2 max co 400 słów, code blocks z syntax highlighting
[ ] Dodać audience scoring do viral analysis
Include exact metrics (not "significant growth" but "245% YoY growth")
Decision Confidence - Data to back choices
Time Savings - 20 hours of research → 20 minutes
Required: Tested code, error handling, prerequisites
Needs: Deep technical analysis, architecture patterns
Utworzono kompletny style guide dla bloga Vector Waves
Professionally Irreverent - poważni o rzemieśle, nie status
**Never publish untested code** (It's not a tutorial, it's a lie)
**Professionally Irreverent** - Serious about craft, not status
Well-Documented Disasters - Learn from others' failures
Minimum 3 primary sources dla każdego trendu
Pain: Either too basic or too jargon-heavy
Każdy agent ma swoje reguły walidacji
**Personal Commentary**: Your take on each trend/tool
Pain: Surface-level content that wastes expertise
**Opinion Clarity**: Strong thesis w pierwszym paragrafie
Skeptical Learner (10%): Needs honest advice, learning paths
**Show Our Work** - Data sources, methodology, failures included
**Humanization**: Industry insider language, "off the record" tone
**Failure Analysis**: What didn't work, pivot points
Check if code would run in fresh environment
Specificity Over Generality - konkretne liczby, nie "significant"
Would we publish this about ourselves?
**Prerequisites Section**: Exact versions, dependencies, setup time
Are we punching up, not down?
Confidently Uncertain - silne opinie, luźno trzymane
**Testing**: Unit tests included, test coverage metrics
Pain: "Learn to code in 30 days" bullshit
**Authority Markers**: "In 10 years of scaling systems...", specific company examples
**Anti-AI Humanization**: Personal debugging experiences, "I discovered", war stories
FORBIDDEN words: revolutionary, game-changing, cutting-edge, leverage
SEO titles różne od display titles
**ROI Focus**: Każdy punkt musi mieć business impact
Output jednego agenta jest sprawdzany przez następnego
Flag any data older than 6 months
"Show Our Work" - zapisuj skąd pochodzi informacja
Time on page vs. read time
**Visual Elements**: 1-2 custom charts/diagrams, nie stock photos
❌ Too Formal: "The application programming interface exhibits suboptimal behavior"
Decision Maker (25%): Needs business implications, accessible depth
Required: Original research, data viz, multiple perspectives
Each topic MUST have minimum 3 primary sources
**Never optimize for algorithms over humans** (Readers > Rankings)
[ ] Zaktualizować prompty agentów o konkretne reguły
**Audience-First**: Technical Founder (35%), Senior Engineer (30%), Decision Maker (25%), Skeptical Learner (10%)
Verify all version numbers are current
Find and verify EVERY numerical claim
Needs: Honest career advice, learning paths
Record: source_url, source_type, data_timestamp for each claim
**Personal Stakes**: Why this matters to you/your company
Technical Founder (35%): Needs strategic insights, contrarian takes
Is this our story to tell?
Pain: Wading through hype to find signal
5+ years experience, seen multiple hype cycles
**Trend Connection**: How items relate to bigger picture
**Curation Criteria**: Why each link matters, not just description
